note.plain: The final consonant in Javanese deŋak, ḍeŋak 'facing upward, craning the neck', laŋak '(puppet with an) upturned gaze', and iŋakuŋak 'crane the neck in an effort to see' can only reflect *k. Since Malay and Sasak -k reflect both *-g and *-k it is possible that the forms cited from these languages contain a root *-ŋak, and are not to be compared directly with the Philippine material.
note.markdown: The final consonant in __language__Javanese__ _deŋak_, _ḍeŋak_ 'facing upward, craning the neck', _laŋak_ '(puppet with an) upturned gaze', and _iŋakuŋak_ 'crane the neck in an effort to see' can only reflect *_k_. Since __language__Malay__ and __language__Sasak__ _-k_ reflect both *_-g_ and *_-k_ it is possible that the forms cited from these languages contain a root *_-ŋak_, and are not to be compared directly with the Philippine material.
